title: Church bulletin: Saturday, June 2, 2018
content: Sermon: "Here's Your Challenge"  Church: Cumberland Presbyterian Church, 910 Booth Ave. Time: 10:30 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Fellowship at 9 a.m. Sunday School at 9:30 a.m.  Sermon: "Thank God for God's Rules" Celebrating the Second Sunday after Pentecost  Church: Faith Lutheran Church (ELCA), 2830 Frederica St. Time: 9:30 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Fellowship time follows worship  Sermon "Thank God for God's Rules" Celebrating the Second Sunday after Pentecost  Church: Trinity Episcopal Church, 720 Ford Ave. Time: 8 a.m. and 11 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Notes: Parish breakfast at 9:45 a.m. Wednesday Noon Eucharist Service at 12:10 p.m.  Sermon: "The Big Idea, Part 1"  Church: Wesleyan Heights United Methodist Church, 1215 Scherm Road Time: 10 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Sunday School 11:15 a.m.  Sermon: "Realizing Our Faith"  Church: St. John United Methodist Church, 2160 Griffith Ave. Time: 10 a.m.  Who's Welcome: Everyone  Note: Sunday School at 9 a.m. Holy Communion will be served during morning worship.  Sermon: "The New Covenant in the Body and Blood of Jesus"  Church: Blessed Mother Catholic Church, 601 E. 23rd St.  Date: Saturday, June 2  Time: 4 p.m.  Who's Welcome: Everyone  Sermon: "Corpus Christi"  Church: Blessed Mother Catholic Church, 601 E. 23rd St. Times: 7 a.m., 10 a.m. and 5:30 p.m.  Who's Welcome: Everyone  Sermon: "The Real Jesus, Part I"  Church: GracePoint Baptist Church, 2339 W. Parrish Ave. Time: 10:30 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Wednesday Bible Study at 6 p.m.  Sermon: "The God Factor"  Church: Lewis Lane Baptist Church, 2600 Lewis Lane Time: 10:15 a.m.  Note: Bible Study at 9 a.m. Event: Vacation Bible School  Church: Zion Baptist Church, 2311 W. Ninth St.  Date: Monday through Friday  Time: 6 to 8 p.m.  Who's welcome: All ages  Event: "Barnyard Blessing" Vacation Bible School  Church: Nickel Ridge Holiness Church, Kentucky 554, one-quarter mile from Kentucky 81.  Date: Monday through Thursday  Time: 6-8:30 p.m.  Note: To be held in the Fellowship Hall.  Event: Yarn Spinners Retreat  Location: Mount St. Joseph Conference and Retreat Center, 12 miles west of Owensboro on Kentucky 56  Date: Saturday and Sunday, June 2-3  Who's welcome: Anyone who enjoys yarn spinning, weaving, rug hooking, knitting or crocheting of all skill levels.  Note: For information about costs and to register, contact Kathy McCarty at 270-229-0206 or kathy.mccarty@maplemount.org, or register online at ursulinesmsj.org  Event: Individual private retreatments  Location: Mount St. Joseph Conference and Retreat Center, 12 miles west of Owensboro on Kentucky 56  Date: Sunday through Saturday  Time: The event begins at 7 p.m. on Sunday and ends after breakfast on Saturday, June 9  Notes: Attendees are invited to feed their faith through private prayer, reflection and quiet time. The fee is $275 and includes room and meals. To register, contact Kathy McCarty at 270-229-0206 or kathy.mccarty@maplemount.org  Event: Evening with an Ursuline dinner and presentation: "Praying with the Ordinary"  Location: Mount St. Joseph Conference and Retreat Center, 12 miles west of Owensboro on Kentucky 56 Time: 5 to 6:30 p.m.  Notes: Cost is $20. Sister Ann McGrew will lead the group in recalling ordinary moments that draw people to an awareness of God through prayer. To register, contact Kathy McCarty at 270-229-0206 or kathy.mccarty@maplemount.org, or register online at ursulinesmsj.org  Event: "Get Answers"  Church: First Free Will Baptist Church, 4314 W. Fifth St. Time: Sessions at 10 a.m. and 11 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Notes: Creation Ministries International's Shane Cessna will provide answers to questions about the existence of God and the theory of evolution.  Event: Movie Night: "Alien Intrusian"  Church: First Free Will Baptist Church  Date: Saturday, June 2  Time: 6 p.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Creation Ministries International presents this documentary that focuses on evolution, UFOs and alien abductions, among other topics. Guest Speakers: Jim and Barbara Wells  Church: New Song Church, 1308 Triplett St. Time: 10 a.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: Intercessory prayer service at 7 p.m. Thursday Event: "Strength for Trayce and Trevor"  Church: Immanuel Baptist Church, 3611 Ralph Ave. Time: 6 a.m. to 2 p.m.  Note: Community garage sale and games and activities for children and adults. Games and activities begin at 10 a.m. All proceeds go to two young boys suffering from a terminal disease to cover expenses not covered by insurance.  Event: Car wash  Location: Advance Auto, 2710 W. Parrish Ave. Time: 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.  Note: Sponsored by Greater Ebenezer Temple Church  Event: Brats, burgers and hot dogs  Location: Family Video, 1212 J.R. Miller Blvd. Time: 11 a.m. to 2 p.m.  Who's welcome: Everyone  Note: The Church of the Living God PGT will be sellling grilled items and drinks in support of its Church Celebration on June 10.  Information to appear in the CHURCH BULLETIN must be delivered in writing to or received in the mail by the Messenger-Inquirer newsroom by 5:30 p.m. the Wednesday before the Saturday of publication. Send information to Steve Vied, Messenger-Inquirer, P.O. Box 1480, Owensboro, KY 42302; svied@messenger-inquirer.com; or fax (270) 686-7868. This is a free service available to all church-related organizations. Notices must include a name and telephone number where further information can be obtained.
